statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

article.headline: SC-Upstate 88, Texas-San Antonio 77
article.story: SPARTANBURG, S.C. -- Torrey Craig scored 31 points and South Carolina Upstate used an early 18-0 run to build a big halftime lead in an 88-77 victory over Texas-San Antonio Saturday. The Spartans (4-5), who also got 15 points apiece from Adrian Rodgers and Ty Greene, led 43-22 at the half and avenged a 67-59 loss at Texas-San Antonio on Nov. 17. Craig has scored in double figures in all nine games this season. The forward shot 9 for 15 from the floor, hitting two 3-pointers. Craig also was 11 for 14 at the foul line. Greene's 15 points came on five treys in six attempts. South Carolina Upstate shot 61.2 percent from the field (30 of 49). Kannon Burrage led Texas-San Antonio (3-6) with 25 points. Forward Jeromie Hill recorded a double-double (23 points, 10 rebounds). Michael Hale III added 16 points as the trio scored 64 of UTSA's points.
